title: Sacked Emmerdale star Asan N'Jie receives racist abuse on Instagram
text:
Ex Emmerdale star Asan N'Jie has revealed he's been subjected to racist abuse since making his return to social media.

The soap star was sacked by ITV from his role as Ellis Chapman on Emmerdale after threatening to kill Hollyoaks actor Jamie Lomas at the TV Choice Awards last month.

He returned to social media two weeks ago but has been forced to hit back at a racist comment.

Comments: Ex Emmerdale star Asan N'Jie has revealed he's been subjected to racist abuse since making his return to social media

One person told him on Instagram earlier this month in a since deleted comment: 'Imagine bringing you 3rd worlders into the civilise world. Hope you never get work again you disgusting subhuman' (sic).

Asan replied: 'Wow. Saynotoracism. I'm bulletporrof so comments like this would never touch me. But on this occasion instead of ignoring it, why not show everyone how upside down the world is? #noroomforracism.'

Asan returned to social media with a defiant message earlier this month, after being sacked from Emmerdale following his awards show brawl.

The actor shared an Instagram post thanking fans for their support as he vowed to 'finish what I started' and make a career comeback.

Comeback: Asan returned to social media with a defiant message earlier this month, after being sacked from Emmerdale following an awards show brawl with actor Jamie Lomas

Posting a smiling photo of himself, Asan wrote: 'All the people who’ve reached out and had my back you’ll never know how much I appreciate you.'

'I’ve learned, I’ve grown and now I’m working harder than ever to finish what I started. Keep you’re circle tight and always fall forward! The universe tends to unfold as it should.'

His post was met with hundreds of supportive comments from his 14.7k followers.

Asan was previously forced to disable the comments on his social media after receiving 'horrific' abuse following his brawl with Jamie, 44.

A source told The Sun: 'Some of the abuse was horrific. He had to take steps to protect himself. The vile comments were getting out of control.'

Drama: The soap star was sacked by ITV from his role as Ellis Chapman on Emmerdale after threatening to 'knife' Hollyoaks actor Jamie at the TV Choice Awards last month

The actor was seen throwing a punch at Jamie during an explosive fight in front of shocked onlookers, shouting: 'I'm going to f*****g kill you'.

Asan, who has been involved in a knife attack Emmerdale plot, could be heard shouting in a video obtained by the Mirror: 'Do you think you are a f*****g big man? I'm going to f*****g kill you. I'm going to f*****g knife you,' before attempting to take a swipe at Jamie.

After the Emmerdale actor threw the punch, I'm A Celebrity's Malique Thompson-Dwyer ran into the room to intervene and bundle Jamie out.

Upsetting: The actor was seen throwing a punch at Jamie during an explosive fight in front of shocked onlookers, before he was sacked two days after footage emerged

According to reports, the pair had to be pulled apart by security twice at the Hilton Park Lane hotel in Mayfair, London, with Asan eventually being escorted off the premises by staff at around 11pm.

Emmerdale announced that Asan had been sacked from the soap two days after footage surfaced of the brawl.

An ITV spokesperson told MailOnline: 'Emmerdale suspended Asan N'Jie yesterday pending further investigation into an incident at a central London hotel on Monday night.

'ITV executives have met with him this morning and as a consequence Asan's contract has been terminated with immediate effect.'

The 'devastated' actor issued a public apology to Jamie as well as 'the whole Emmerdale team, our audience, ITV, my family, and the organisers of the TV Choice Awards.'

Fired: Asan was forced to disable the comments on his social media after receiving 'horrific' abuse following his brawl with Jamie, 44

In a further statement given to MailOnline, Asan said: 'My behaviour at the TV Choice Awards was completely unacceptable and very much out of character.

'I sincerely apologise to everybody who has been affected especially Jamie Lomas, the whole Emmerdale team, our audience, ITV, my family, and the organisers of the TV Choice Awards.

'I am devastated, accept full responsibility for my actions and I am determined to learn from this.'

Asan's brawl with Jamie was reportedly sparked by a financial dispute with one of his co-stars.

A source told The Sun that Asan allegedly goaded Jamie into lashing out, as the Hollyoaks star was awaiting commission for working with the star in the early days of his career.

Exit: Asan's final scenes on Emmerdale were aired last week, with his character Ellis Chapman moving to live with his mother Jessie in Dubai

According to the source Jamie was managing Asan's co-star - who is yet to be named - at his First Take Acting school, and helped him land one of his first roles in Emmerdale.

The actor in question had decided to leave Jamie's agency, but is yet to pay the full commission. They said: 'Jamie had guided this young lad's career and was responsible for him landing a gig in Emmerdale.

'He is entitled to this money but it's currently the subject of a private and personal dispute.'

Explaining how the brawl started, the source added: 'Asan went up to Jamie and started goading him, saying things like, ''Alright, Jamie big b*****ks''.'

Jamie has since returned to his role as Warren Fox in Hollyoaks, with the actor pictured back on set in Liverpool last week.

Asan's final scenes on Emmerdale meanwhile were aired last week, with his character Ellis Chapman moving to live with his mother Jessie in Dubai.
description: Ex Emmerdale star Asan N'Jie has revealed he's been subjected to racist abuse since making his return to social media.
